lead_paragraph: An initiative to increase diversity in the national force is seen as an effort to ease deep-rooted tension between officers and Arab citizens.

byline.contributor: Al Baker contributed reporting from New York.

headline.print_headline: Israel Seeking Police Recruits: Eager, and Arab
headline.main: Israel Seeking Police Recruits: Eager, and Arab

snippet: An initiative to increase diversity in the national force is seen as an effort to ease deep-rooted tension between officers and Arab citizens....
abstract: Israeli police force has begun push to recruit Arab Muslims, population vastly underrepresented among its ranks and overrepresented among criminals and victims; Arab Muslims comprise 1.5 percent of 30,000-member national police force, and goal is to 1,350 new ones in three years; deep distrust between Arabs, many of whom identify as Palestinian, and Israelis presents steep challenge.
